title: Manchester Arndale stabbings: Screams after knifeman 'lunges at multiple people'
text:

Horrified shoppers expressed their sheer panic after a "knifeman lunged at people with a blade" at a shopping centre today.

At least five people have been "randomly stabbed" at Manchester Arndale centre, including a man with serious back and stomach injuries.

Harrowing photos shows a man lying face down while counter-terrorism police point Tasers at him.

Another image shows a victim being treated by paramedics inside Starbucks.

"A man was running around with a knife lunging at multiple people, one of which came into my store visibly shaken with a small graze," one shop worker, who only gave his name as Jordan, said.

"Soon after, security staff told all retail staff to close their doors and move the public to the back of the stores."

The 23-year-old, who has only been working at the centre for a few months, said the attack took place on the ground floor at around 11.15am.

In addition to the men's wounds, two women were stabbed in the hand.

(Image: Manchester Evening News WS)

Other shoppers shared their distress.

Freddie Houlder, 22, said he heard "a load of screams just outside" the shop he was in.

He added: "He was running around going for as many people as possible.

"I was in Office about 10 meters away from where someone potentially got stabbed.

(Image: @JohnGre07881147 /Twitter)

"I was in the shop, a woman came in really quickly.

"She had been grazed by a knife, they locked the doors, they evacuated the shop 15 minutes after.

"They put curtains around where people have been stabbed. The woman was standing outside the shop. They caught the guy. She burst into tears, she was so lucky she was wearing a thick jacket."

(Image: Copyright Cavendish Press)

(Image: Copyright Cavendish Press)

And an office worker said: "There’s just a lot of confusion and panic up here, they just aren’t letting any of us out of the lobby."

"There are hundreds of us in the offices up here. Our information is quite limited. They aren’t letting us out of the office at the minute.

"I assume they think we’re safe up here. We’re not allowed into the main Arndale shopping centre."

A man in his 40s has been arrested on suspicion of serious assault. He has been taken to custody for questioning.

Counter-terrorism police are leading the operation.

(Image: PA)

A spokesman for Greater Manchester Police said: "Specialist officers are continuing to respond to an incident at the Arndale shopping centre in Manchester city centre.

"We can confirm that five people have been stabbed and taken to hospital.

"In these early stages we are keeping an open mind about the motivation of this terrible incident and the circumstances as we know them.

"Given the location of the incident and its nature officers from Counter Terrorism Police North West are leading the investigation as we determine the circumstances.

"A man in his 40s – who was arrested at the scene on suspicion of serious assault – remains in custody for questioning."

A Starbucks statement reads: We are aware of this incident and are supporting local authorities as they respond. Our immediate priority is the wellbeing of our partners (employees) and customers in the area, and we will refer all further questions to the Greater Manchester Police Department.”
description: Manchester Arndale centre is on lockdown after Greater Manchester Police descended on Exchange Square near Starbucks
